Posts.Content: Does anyone have any information on Heparan Sulfate?  Is it FDA approved, is it a chemo, hormonal drug?  Any information would be appreciated.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: Heparan Sulfate

Posts.Content: This is from  a newsletter I got from  Cancer Compass  - here it is:Study Finds Sugar Supports Metastasis May 8, 2007 SAN DIEGO -- U.S. scientists have discovered targeting a sugar that supports blood vessel growth might inhibit cancer. In a study that could point to new therapies to prevent metastasis, University of California-San Diego researchers note solid tumors need a network of blood vessels, or vasculature, to metastasize. The researchers, led by Professor Jeffrey Esko, discovered modifying the action of heparan sulfate uniquely impacted the tumor vasculature, and in doing so, altered the growth rate of tumors prepared from lung carcinoma cells in mice. "An important finding was that, not only could we inhibit the growth of tumors in these mice, but that other systems that rely on endothelial growth, such as the reproductive system and wound healing, remained robust," said Dr. Mark Fuster, the study's first author. "If novel drugs can be developed to target tumor heparan sulfate, we might be able to make a leap in cancer-fighting therapies ..." The findings are published in the current on-line issue of the Journal of Cell Biology. Copyright 2007 by United Press International
Posts.Title: Heparan Sulfate

Posts.Content: On 5/22/2007 Jcsfree wrote:   On 4/28/2007 Marilli wrote: Hi - I am looking for someone that has had an organ transpant and ended up with any type of cancer.  I am a male with metastatic breast cancer.  I never had chemo due to having a suppressed immune system.  Is there anyone that has had a transplant of any kind and ended with up with cancer and did chemotherapy?  Am wondering how this affected your immune system and what type of chemo did you have.  Any information is appreciated.  Thank you.   Hi, I am a kidney transplant patient.  I had Thyroid cancer and radio-iodine therapy and now have a breast lump and waiting diagnosis.  So, I have not had the traditional chemo...yet.  But thought I would introduce myself because I think we are a rare breed.  Us lucky folks with less than perfect immune systems to fight cancer.  This is my second transplant and I am chronically rejecting it too.  I was diagnosed with a blood proliferative disorder in early 2000 which is also raising its ugly head these days.  This disease can turn to Leukemia.   I have a high white and platlet blood count.  My doctor at NIH in Bethesda Maryland is currently doing research on transplanted organs without immunesurpression.  The sad thing for us is that while we do not die from our original organ failure disease, we probably will get cancer.  My prayers are with you my friend.   JCSFree
Posts.Title: Liver Transplant and Metastatic Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi - I am looking for someone that has had an organ transpant and ended up with any type of cancer.  I am a male with metastatic breast cancer.  I never had chemo due to having a suppressed immune system.  Is there anyone that has had a transplant of any kind and ended with up with cancer and did chemotherapy?  Am wondering how this affected your immune system and what type of chemo did you have.  Any information is appreciated.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: Liver Transplant and Metastatic Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: On 12/14/2007 Marilli wrote:   On 5/22/2007 Jcsfree wrote:   On 4/28/2007 Marilli wrote: Hi - I am looking for someone that has had an organ transpant and ended up with any type of cancer.  I am a male with metastatic breast cancer.  I never had chemo due to having a suppressed immune system.  Is there anyone that has had a transplant of any kind and ended with up with cancer and did chemotherapy?  Am wondering how this affected your immune system and what type of chemo did you have.  Any information is appreciated.  Thank you.   Hi, I am a kidney transplant patient.  I had Thyroid cancer and radio-iodine therapy and now have a breast lump and waiting diagnosis.  So, I have not had the traditional chemo...yet.  But thought I would introduce myself because I think we are a rare breed.  Us lucky folks with less than perfect immune systems to fight cancer.  This is my second transplant and I am chronically rejecting it too.  I was diagnosed with a blood proliferative disorder in early 2000 which is also raising its ugly head these days.  This disease can turn to Leukemia.   I have a high white and platlet blood count.  My doctor at NIH in Bethesda Maryland is currently doing research on transplanted organs without immunesurpression.  The sad thing for us is that while we do not die from our original organ failure disease, we probably will get cancer.  My prayers are with you my friend.   JCSFree   Hi - I just now looked at this board and saw your message.  It is my husband that I am writing about.  I am sorry for al your problems.  I was hoping to find someone who had a transplant and ended up with cancer and tried chemo.  My husband had a liver transplant 8 yers ago but has had cancer for the last 6 years.  He has been treated with hormonal drugs and now they want him to try things that are for prostrate cancer.  I posted about Flutamite, which concerns us for it can cause liver failure, thus far, he has not taken it, but his tumor markers are on the rise.  He has bone metastasis and it also went to his lung.  He had ir radiated but it is back.  Please bring me up to date on how you are doing.  Hopefully, you are still looking at this site and am sorry I just came across it today.  I wish you the best of luck and hpe to hear from you.  Wishing you welll.  Idi
Posts.Title: Liver Transplant and Metastatic Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi - My husband has cancer to the bones and other places.  It has gone to one of his lungs and he had it radiated, it came back and it was radiated again, so radiation to the same place is definitely a possibility.
Posts.Title: Information please.

Posts.Content: Can someone explain this to me Protein That Cuts Malignancy Of Breast Cancer Discovered   Is there a name for this, what protein are they talking about.  Thank you.
Posts.Title: Protein That Cuts Malignancy Of Breast Cancer Discovered
